person.persName: Elijah Hise (Logan County, Kentucky, attorney, judge, postmaster, policitican, and diplomat)

body.p: Logan County, Kentucky, attorney, judge, politician, and diplomat. Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, native. Son of Frederick Hise and Nancy Eckstein Hise. Married to Elvira Stewart Hise in Davidson County, Tennessee, on October 9, 1832. Graduate of Transylvania University in 1823. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1829. U.S. postmaster in Logan County, Kentucky, from February 8, 1837, to July 29, 1839. Owned two enslaved persons in Logan County in 1840. Charg√© d'affaires to Guatemala from March 31, 1848, to June 21, 1849. Attorney in Logan County in 1850. Member of the Court of Appeals of Kentucky from 1851 to 1854. Chief justice of the Court of Appeals of Kentucky from 1852 to 1854. Law jurist in Logan County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Logan County in 1860.
